Posted By: Demonic_Angel13 (7/9/2010 9:57:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
this card isn't broken. as has been said, there are plenty of ways to deal with it. there's so much removal out there (you can just [smite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=smite) it with the freekin [birds of paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=birds of paradise)) that your strategy has to be bigger than one playset of tough creatures. if this thing is killing you, you need to put better cards in your deck. [act of treason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=act of treason), [fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fling), that's always fun. you can buy playsets of both for 3 bucks. [cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cancel), [mana leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mana leak). [plummet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=plummet). these are all commons.   
  
one of the best creatures out there, but not unbeatable.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I really don't get how people see this as being so powerful. You could probably find some way to get a 5/5 flyer with first strike and lifelink for about the same CMC, and pro Demons/Dragons is really only a problem if you use nothing else.   
  
Not saying it's not a good card; I'd definitely run it if I had it. But I still don't think it really deserves the "OMFG BANESLAYER!!!" reaction.
posts.html:
I really don't get how people see this as being so powerful. You could probably find some way to get a 5/5 flyer with first strike and lifelink for about the same CMC, and pro Demons/Dragons is really only a problem if you use nothing else.

Not saying it's not a good card; I'd definitely run it if I had it. But I still don't think it really deserves the "OMFG BANESLAYER!!!" reaction.

posts.post_content:
@OmegaD, Gimme a break. Black lotus was an obvious development flaw that happened on the very first edition of Magic. Wizards has since acknowledged the error and stopped printing it (among other abusers, such as the Power 9) since the Revised edition (got it? REVISED).   
  
The fact that, 17 years later after that, Wizards is making a mistake of the same kind reveals that either there's a long way towards a balanced game, or (i think the most possible answer) they are just trying to make some money.   
  
Because, you see, basic economics would tell you that the best way to keep the prices up is to keep supply low, and by printing cards like these, [Vengevine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengevine), Jace, [The Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Mind Sculptor), [Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra), among other aberrations of power creep, on MYTHIC rarity status, it's pretty obvious that WotC's main mission right now is to take as much money as they can of the wallets of gamers like you.   
  
" Fact is, overpowered is OK as long as it'... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
